page.title: 20TOWN AND HEATHLAND BIRDS.
page.content: Talbot Heath is a paradise for birds because it's quiet and undisturbed. A rarely seen bird is the kingfisher, which is found near rivers and streams. It flies like a flash of blue electricity. It eats minnows and sticklebacks and it swoops on aquatic insects. The skylark is common, it uses the grasses around it to make a nest. In summer it hovers, singing continuously. Bullfinches prefer the dense foliage of woods and hedgerows where they build their nests. They are fond of bathing and splashing in pools,they sometimes sip from the clear water of the Bourne stream. Also inhabiting the heath are many magpies, they eat insects and eggs but are invading the town as builders invade their territory.
